sen.j: 遵義堂（じゅんぎどう）は、1808年（文化 (元号)5年）に設立された膳所藩の藩校。
sen.e: Jungido is a hanko (domain school) founded by the Zeze Domain in 1808.
Jungido is a hanko (school for the descendants of feudal lords) founded by the Zeze clan in 1808.
sen.cmt: 「じゅんぎどう」に対する適切な単純な言葉が見つからない為、描写しました。
sen.e: "Jungido" is a hanko (school for the descendants of feudal lords) founded by the Zeze clan in 1808.
sen.cmt: 統一リストその他（2009/6/29）の指示に従い、Jungido をダブルコーテーションで括りました。

sen.j: 第十代藩主本多康完が、儒学者皆川淇園のすすめにより、1808年（文化5年）9月設立した。
sen.e: The 10th lord of the domain, Yasusada HONDA, founded the school in September 1808 at the suggestion of a Confusian scholar, Kien NINAGAWA.
The 10th feudal lord Yasusada HONDA, founded the school in September 1808 at the suggestion of Kien NINAGAWA, a Confusian scholar.
sen.cmt: feudal lord の方がつじます。
sen.e: The 10th feudal lord Yasusada HONDA, founded the school in September 1808 at the suggestion of Kien NINAGAWA, a Confusian scholar.

sen.j: 教育内容は手習や四書五経で、幕末には蘭学と西洋砲術が加わった。
sen.e: Tenarai (Japanese calligraphy) and Shishogokyo (the Four Books and Five Classics of Confucianism, the Nine Chinese Classics) were taught, and Western studies and Western gunnery were added to the curriculum at the end of the Edo period.

Tenarai (Japanese calligraphy) and Shishogokyo (the Four Books and Five Classics of Confucianism, otherwise known as the Nine Chinese Classics) were taught, and Western studies and Western gunnery were added to the curriculum at the end of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 赤は混乱しないための書き足す
sen.e: Tenarai (Japanese calligraphy) and Shishogokyo (the Four Books and Five Classics of Confucianism, otherwise known as the Nine Chinese Classics) were taught, and Western studies and Western gunnery were added to the curriculum at the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 現在、跡地には滋賀県立膳所高等学校が建つ。
sen.e: Currently, Zeze Koto Gakko (high school), a Shiga prefectural high school, is built on the site of Jungido.
Currently, Zeze Koto Gakko (high school), a Shiga prefectural high school, is built on the former site of Jungido.
sen.cmt: [跡地]の訳すが必要と判断しました。
sen.e: Currently, Zeze Koto Gakko (high school), a Shiga prefectural high school, is built on the former site of Jungido.
